com.xrtb.common

Class Campaign

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xrtb.common.Campaign
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable

    public class Campaign
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable
    A class that implements a campaign. Provide the campaign with evaluation Nodes (a stack) and a bid request, and this campaign will determine if the bid request in question matches this campaign.
    Author:
    Ben M. Faul

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.lang.String adId
      The id (name) of the campaign
      java.lang.String adomain
      The default ad domain
      java.util.List<Node> attributes
      The list of constraint nodes for this campaign
      java.util.List<Creative> creatives
      The list of creatives for this campaign
      double price
      The default price associated with the campaign
      java.util.Map template
      An empty template for the exchange formatted message

      Encode the values of all the attributes, instantiating from JSON does not do this, it's an incomplete serialization Always call this if you add a campaign without using Configuration.getInstance().addCampaign();

    • Method Detail

      • copy

        public Campaign copy()
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Creates a copy of this campaign
        Returns:
        Campaign. A campaign that is an exact clone of this one
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - on JSON parse errors.

      • encodeCreatives

        public void encodeCreatives()
        Enclose the URL fields. GSON doesn't pick the 2 encoded fields up, so you have to make sure you encode them. This is an important step, the WIN processing will get mangled if this is not called before the campaign is used. Configuration.getInstance().addCampaign() will call this for you.

      • encodeAttributes

        public void encodeAttributes()
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Encode the values of all the attributes, instantiating from JSON does not do this, it's an incomplete serialization Always call this if you add a campaign without using Configuration.getInstance().addCampaign();
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the attributes of the node could not be encoded.

      • add

        public void add(Node node)
        Add an evaluation node to the campaign.
        Parameters:
        node. - Node - the evaluation node to be added to the set.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(java.lang.Object o)
        The compareTo method to ensure that multiple campaigns don't exist with the same id.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable
        Parameters:
        o. - Object. The object to compare with.
        Returns:
        int. Returns 1 if the ids match, otherwise 0.

        public java.lang.String toJson()
        Returns this object as a JSON string
